title: Human-Machine Interface Standards
content: HMI design affects error rates and response times. Controls should map intuitively to system function. Displays should prioritize critical information and minimize clutter. Follow EEMUA 201 and ASM Consortium guidelines. Inconsistent HMI design across systems creates negative transfer and increases errors.
openQuestions: Are HMI designs standardized across your rig's control systems?
When have you operated a control where the interface behaved opposite to your expectation?
